bug.short_desc: package link-grammar has file name conflict with package minisat2
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Error: Transaction check error: file /usr/lib64/libminisat.so.2 from install of link-grammar-5.3.10-1.fc25.x86_64 conflicts with file from package minisat2-libs-2.2.1-1.fc25.x86_64
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): link-grammar-5.3.10-1.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible: every time
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Have minisat2 installed 2. Try to install link-grammar-5.3.10-1.fc25.x86_64 3.
Actual results: Above error
Expected results: no error
Additional info:

I can't get link-grammar to use system minisat2 rather than bundling it's own. I've filed a bug upstream.
https://github.com/opencog/link-grammar/issues/415
In the interim, if I simply exclude the minisat solibs from the link-grammar RPMs, it seems to work, because the solib major version is the same, just if that changes it will break. If I don't hear from upstream soon I'll push that change but I'd rather build with system minisat2.
Thanks for the explanation and the action.
Upstream has been very responsive, and they should have a fix out soon.

link-grammar-5.3.11-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-d745cd0b72
This version successfully updated from the repositories in F25. Thank you.
